htsjdk.samtools.util
Interface LocationAware

All Known Subinterfaces:
Positional
All Known Implementing Classes:
AsciiLineReader, AsciiLineReaderIterator, BlockCompressedInputStream, BlockCompressedOutputStream, PositionalBufferedStream
public interface LocationAware

Describes API for getting current position in a stream, writer, or underlying file. The expected functionality is simple: if you are a output stream / writer, and you've written 50 bytes to the stream, then getPosition() should return 50; if you are an input stream or file reader, and you've read 25 bytes from the object, then it should return 25. In the context of an iterator or any producer-like object that doesn't map directly to a byte stream, getPosition() should return the position (in the underlying stream being read/written to) of the most-recently read/written element. For example, if you are reading lines from a file with a AsciiLineReaderIterator, calling getPosition() should return the byte position of the start of the most recent line returned by AsciiLineReaderIterator.next().

Author:
mccowan

Method Summary
 long getPosition()
          The current offset, in bytes, of this stream/writer/file.
 

Method Detail

getPosition

long getPosition()
The current offset, in bytes, of this stream/writer/file. Or, if this is an iterator/producer, the offset (in bytes) of the END of the most recently returned record (since a produced record corresponds to something that has been read already). See class javadoc for more. Note that for BGZF files, this does not represent an actually file position, but a virtual file pointer.
